objects.name: NewText
objects.string:
My dear darly, my carly.
To succeed you must, thoust.
To kill the bugs, and avoid the lost.
Hit the buttons to move.
Hit shoot buton to shove, the bullet in their ore.
My darling, my carly.

Enjoy my greatestestestest gift, my caring darling.

eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: PanelSpriteButton
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: A button that can be customized.
description: The button can be customized with a background for each state and a label. It handles user interactions and a simple condition can be used to check if it is clicked.
There are ready-to-use buttons in the asset-store [menu buttons pack](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?initial-dialog=asset-store&asset-pack=menu-buttons-menu-buttons).

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: The finite state machine used internally by the button object.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: ButtonFSM

events.comment: The "Validated" state only last one frame.
Make sure the cursor position is only checked once per frame.
Touches are always pressed, so ShouldCheckHovering doesn't matter.

eventsBasedObjects.description: A button that can be customized.
eventsBasedObjects.name: PanelSpriteButton

events.comment:
Create one background instance for of each state.
Only the instance for the current state is shown.
Place the label over the backgrounds.
Show the right background accordingly to the new state.

Children instances must be resized when the button size change:
- backgrounds for each state are resized to take the full dimensions of the button
- the label is put back at the center of the button

The scale is set back to 1 because it means that the parent instance has the same dimensions as the union of its children instances.

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: @4ian, Entropy, VegeTato
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: Flash
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Make an object flash visibility (blink), color tint, object effect, or opacity (fade).
description: Make an object flash for a period of time so that it alternates between two different states.
Includes the ability to flash visibility (blink), color tint, object effect, or opacity (fade).
After adding a behavior to an object, you **trigger the effect** by using the **Flash action**.
This can be used to:
- Let players know they are invincible after being hit
- Catch player attention on the interface (for instance a "press start" text)

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: D8H
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: Sticker
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Make objects follow the position and rotation of the object they are stuck to.
description: This extension can be useful to:
* Stick accessories to moving objects
* Animate a skeleton
* Delete an object with another one
An example allows to check it out ([open the project online](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?project=example://stick-objects)).

eventsFunctions.description: Define helper classes JavaScript code.
eventsFunctions.name: DefineHelperClasses

inlineCode: * Update the coordinates in the basisObject basis.
* It uses the basisObject coordinates from the previous frame.
* This way, the sticker can move relatively to it and still
// Save initial values to avoid calculus and rounding errors
* Copy the coordinates to use it the next frame.
* This method is also called by children to ensure
// If the behavior on the basis object has a different name,
// the objects will still follow their basis objects
// Follow parents 1st to avoid frame delays
object.setX(basisObject.getCenterXInScene() + object.getX() - object.getCenterXInScene() + deltaX * Math.cos(angle) + deltaY * Math.sin(angle));
object.setY(basisObject.getCenterYInScene() + object.getY() - object.getCenterYInScene() - deltaX * Math.sin(angle) + deltaY * Math.cos(angle));
// Unproportional dimensions changes won't work as expected
// if the object angle is not null but nothing more can be done
// because there is no full affine transformation on objects.

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the object is stuck to another object.
eventsFunctions.name: IsStuck

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Stick the object to another. Use the action to stick the object, or unstick it later.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: Sticker

inlineCode: // Set up the scene sticker objects list - if not done already.
// Register this object as a sticker.

eventsFunctions.description: Stick on another object.
eventsFunctions.name: Stick

inlineCode: // An object can stick to only one object.

eventsFunctions.description: Unstick from the object it was stuck to.
eventsFunctions.name: Unstick

propertyDescriptors.label: Destroy when the object it's stuck on is destroyed
propertyDescriptors.name: IsDestroyedWithParent

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: Tristan Rhodes (https://victrisgames.itch.io/)
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: ShakeObject
description: Shake an object (position, angle or scale).
It can be used for:
- Hit or impact
- Object slowly rocking back and forth (like a ship)
- Simulate engine vibration, earthquake, or pulsing
The top-down RPG example uses this extension for damage animations ([open the project online](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?project=example://top-down-rpg)).

eventsBasedBehaviors.description:
Shake an object, using one or more ways to shake (position, angle).
This behavior can be used on any type of object.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: ShakeObject_PositionAngle

eventsFunctions.name: ShakeObject_PositionAngle

Pass input parameters to global variables so that onScenePostEvents can use them

Detect initial shake
Initiate the onScenePostEvents function

Run once before every shake movement

events.name: Correct for drift and reset drift tracking variables

events.comment: Move to correct any drift from previous shake
Reset drift detection variables
Calculate Position Shake
PositionDisplacement = (DesiredDuration - RunningTimer) / DesiredDuration * Amplitude * [-1 or 1]
Make initial shake NOT random so users can set a direction for a one-shake effect
After initial shake pick a random direction
Calculate Rotation (angle) shake
Every "even" shake, rotate clockwise
AngleDisplacement = (DesiredDuration - RunningTimer) / DesiredDuration * Amplitude
Every "odd" shake, rotate counter-clockwise
AngleDisplacement = (DesiredDuration - RunningTimer) / DesiredDuration * Amplitude
Save that initial shake has been processed
Calculate the fraction of shake that occured during this frame
Increase change for the first half of the shake (move away from original values)
Change position
Save movement to calculate drift
Change angle
Save movement to calculate drift
Decrease change the second half of the shake (return to original position)
Change position
Save movement to calculate drift
Change angle
Save movement to calculate drift
Stop shaking when the duration has been reached (or if the stop shaking function was called)

events.comment: Keep object shaking forever (if desired)
Run once before every shake movement

events.name: Correct for drift and reset drift tracking variables

events.comment: Move to correct any drift from previous shake
Reset drift detection variables
Calculate Position Shake
PositionDisplacement = (DesiredDuration - RunningTimer) / DesiredDuration * Amplitude * [-1 or 1]
Make initial shake NOT random so users can set a direction for a one-shake effect
After initial shake pick a random direction
Calculate Rotation (angle) shake
Every "even" shake, rotate clockwise
AngleDisplacement = (DesiredDuration - RunningTimer) / DesiredDuration * Amplitude
Every "odd" shake, rotate counter-clockwise
AngleDisplacement = (DesiredDuration - RunningTimer) / DesiredDuration * Amplitude
Calculate Scale shake
Calculate object scale displacement, with linear decay over time
ScaleDisplacement = (DesiredDuration - RunningTimer) / DesiredDuration * Amplitude *  1/100
Every even shake, increase scale
Every "odd" shake, decrease scale
ScaleDisplacement = -1 * (DesiredDuration - RunningTimer) / DesiredDuration * Amplitude *  1/100
Save that initial shake has been processed
Calculate the fraction of shake that occured during this frame
Increase change for the first half of the shake (move away from original values)

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: @4ian
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: Health
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Manage health points and damage, including a protective shield and armor.
description: Manage health points including a protective shield and armor. Health can be assigned to players, enemies, NPCs, or even inanimate objects such as breaking doors and mining rocks.
Damage calculations are performed in this order:
Incoming Damage -> Is Damage Cooldown active? -> Chance to Dodge -> Flat Damage Reduction -> Percent Damage Reduction -> Damage to Shield -> Damage to Health
How to use:
- Set desired values in behavior properties
- To apply damage use “Apply damage to an object”
- To heal health, use “Heal object” action
- To activate the shield, use “Activate shield” action
- Health and shield regeneration will happen automatically based on properties
Tips:
- While damage cooldown is active, no damage will be applied to health or shield (the object is invincible)
- Try using the “Blink” extension while damage cooldown is active
- Use the “Is just damaged” or "Is just healed" conditions to trigger sound and visual effects
Health properties:
- Starting health points
- Maximum health points. Use "0" for no maximum
- Damage cooldown (seconds) Use "0" for no cooldown
- Rate of health regeneration (points per second)
- Delay before health regeneration starts after being hit (seconds)
- Allow heals to increase health above max health (regen will never exceed max health)
Shield properties:
- Max shield points. Use "0" for no maximum
- Duration of shield (seconds) Use "0" to make shield permanent
- Rate of shield regeneration (points per second)
- Delay before shield regeneration starts after being hit (seconds)
- Block excess damage when shield is broken (yes/no)
The top-down RPG example uses this extension ([open the project online](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?project=example://top-down-rpg)).

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Manage health (life) points including a protective shield and armor.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: Health

eventsFunctions.description: Apply damage to the object. Shield and armor can reduce this damage if enabled.

eventsFunctions.sentence: Apply _PARAM2_ points of damage to _PARAM0_ (Damage can be reduced by Shield: _PARAM3_, Armor: _PARAM4_)

events.comment: Only consider incoming damage when damage cooldown is not active
No damage will be applied when dodged
If shield is active, damage the shield first
If damage is less than shield, subtract damage from shield.
If damage is greater than shield, conditionally apply excess damage based on property
Apply excess damage only if shield does not block excess damage

eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: BoidsMovement
description: Simulates swarms or flocks movement following the separation, alignment, cohesion principles. The flock can be attracted to a location or avoid some obstacles.
The [Fish School example](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?project=example://fish-school) shows how properties impact on the movement.

eventsFunctions.description: Define helper classes JavaScript code.
eventsFunctions.name: DefineHelperClasses

inlineCode: * Adds a velocity to this vector
* @param {Vector} referenceVector gets the velocity to be added
* Subtracts vectors verticies from a reference vector
* Methods for Separation, Cohesion, Alignment added
* Inspired from The Nature of Code - Daniel Shiffman
* @param {Vector} vector the vector to return the result
* Applys the three rules of boids
* Apply the acceleration from the steer force.
* Calculates and applies steering force towards a direction
* Alignment: calculate the average velocity for every nearby boid in the system
* Cohesion: calculate direction vector towards the average location of all nearby boids
// A vector pointing from the position to the target
* Add a boid to the R-Tree.
* Remove a boid from the R-Tree.
* Returns all the boids around the specified boid.
* @return {Boid[]} An array with all boids near the object.
// TODO The R-Tree should not allocate an array.
// Cap the number of boids between 20 and 40.
for (let i = 0; i < nearbys.length; i += step) {

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Move as part of a flock.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: BoidsMovement

Update boids position every frame

eventsFunctions.description: Intend to avoid an area with a given center and radius.
eventsFunctions.name: AvoidPosition
eventsFunctions.sentence: _PARAM0_ intend to avoid a radius of _PARAM4_ around _PARAM2_; _PARAM3_ (decision weight: _PARAM5_)

events.comment:
Evaluate at which distance the object will go past a location if it were to continue in its current direction.

speedUnitX = velocityX / speed
speedUnitY = velocityY / speed

deltaX = centerX - object.CenterX
deltaY = centerY - object.CenterY

normalX = -deltaY;
normalY = deltaX;

trajectoryDistance = speedUnitX * normalX + speedUnitY * normalY
If this distance is smaller than the specified radius, the Boid must try turn in the right direction to avoid the area.
(normalX ; normalY)
(-normalX ; -normalY)

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: Gustavo Marciano
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: YSort
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Create an illusion of depth by setting the Z-order based on the Y position of the object. Useful for isometric games, 2D games with a "Top-Down" view, RPG...
description: Set the depth (Z-order) of the instance to the value of its Y position in the scene, creating an illusion of depth. The origin point of the object is used to determine the Z-order.
This is useful for:
- isometric games ([open the project online](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?project=example://isometric-game))
- top-down games ([open the project online](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?project=example://top-down-grid-movement))

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Set the depth (Z-order) of the instance to the value of its Y position in the scene, creating an illusion of depth. The origin point of the object is used to determine the Z-order.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: YSort

events.comment: This is done in doStepPostEvents because the sort must happens right before the rendering to avoid a 1 frame delay.

eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: DraggablePhysics
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Drag a physics object with the mouse (or touch).
description: Enables players to click and drag on physics objects to move them.  The object retains velocity when the click is released, allowing players to fling objects across the screen.
Note:
- The default "draggable" behavior will not work on objects with the physics behavior. This extension should be used instead.
- This extension will only work on objects that have the physics behavior.
- Kinematic physics mode is incompatible with this extension. The object will be changed to dynamic mode.
The Parking Jam example uses this extension ([open the project online](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?project=example://parking-jam)).

events.comment: This allows to detect a change of "intial value" on hot reload.
Create the child-object instances.
Create the label over the bar.
Pass the configuration to the behavior.

Children instances must be resized when the parent size change:
- background is resized to take the full dimensions of the parent
- the bar size is refreshed according to the value
- the label is put back at the center of the bar

The scale is set back to 1 because it means that the parent instance has the same dimensions as the union of its children instances.

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: @4ian
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: FireBullet
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Fire bullets, manage ammo, reloading and overheating.
description: This extension allows objects to fire bullets.
It handles:
- Cooldown between shots
- Firing multiple bullets at a time ([open the project online](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?project=example://fire-bullet))
- Ammo management
- Overheat
It can be used for:
- Twin-stick shooters ([open the project online](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?project=example://conviction-of-gun-dude-desktop))
- Shoot'em up ([open the project online](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?project=example://space-shooter))
A simple example shows how to make firing patterns ([open the project online](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?project=example://firing-patterns)).

Only reload the amount of ammo available
